questions.question: What is the purpose of filter at the output side of diode bridge rectifier?

answers.a: It reduces the ripple content in the output voltage only and decreases dc-load power.
answers.b: It reduces the ripple content in the output voltage, output current and increases the dc-load power.
answers.c: There will be no change in any of the parameters.
answers.d: The ripple content in the output dc-load voltage increases.

explanations.b: Explanation 2: A filter at the output of a diode bridge rectifier reduces ripple content.

questions.question: 2. What will happen if one of the diodes in an uncontrolled diode bridge rectifier is permanently open?

answers.a: Nothing will change it works as before.
answers.b: It works as uncontrolled half wave rectifier.

explanations.b: Explanation 2: Only half of the input AC cycle is rectified, resulting in half-wave rectification.

questions.question: 3. When a capacitor is added at the output side what happens to the average and RMS output voltages?

explanations.d: Explanation 4: Adding a capacitor at the output increases the average DC output voltage by smoothing ripples while decreasing the RMS voltage.
